intro: Adenandra linearis, commonly known as the narrowleaf adenandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to South Africa, where it typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant features slender, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Adenandra linearis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
